00026 #define cbBTPAN_RESULT_OK                    ((cb_int32)0x00000000)
00027 #define cbBTPAN_RESULT_ERROR                 ((cb_int32)0x00000001)
00028 #define cbBTPAN_RESULT_ILLEGAL_HANDLE        ((cb_int32)0x00000002)
00029 #define cbBTPAN_RESULT_FLOW_STOP             ((cb_int32)0x00000003)
00030 #define cbBTPAN_RESULT_LINK_LOSS             ((cb_int32)0x00000004)
00031 
00032 /*===========================================================================
00033 * TYPES
00034 *=========================================================================*/
00035 typedef cb_uint32   cbBTPAN_Handle;
00036 
00037 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00038 * Callback to indicate that a Bnep connection has been established.
00039 *
00040 * @param connHandle: Connection handle
00041 * @param info: Information about the connection
00042 *
00043 * @return None
00044 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00045 typedef void(*cbBTPAN_ConnectEvt)             (cbBCM_Handle connHandle, cbBCM_ConnectionInfo info);
00046 
00047 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00048 * Callback to indicate that a Bnep connection has been disconnected.
00049 *
00050 * @param connHandle: Connection handle
00051 *
00052 * @return None
00053 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00054 typedef void(*cbBTPAN_DisconnectEvt)          (cbBCM_Handle connHandle);
00055 
00056 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00057 * Callback to indicate that data has been received from remote device.
00058 *
00059 * @param btPanHandle: PAN handle
00060 * @param length: Length of the data
00061 * @param pData: Pointer to the data
00062 *
00063 * @return None
00064 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00065 typedef void(*cbBTPAN_DataEvt)             (cbBCM_Handle connHandle, cb_uint8* pData, cb_uint16 length);
00066 
00067 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00068 * Callback to indicate that data has been taken care by PAN. New
00069 * data can now be sent on this handle.
00070 *
00071 * @param btPanHandle: PAN handle
00072 * @param result: cbBTPAN_RESULT_OK if the data sending succeeded
00073 *
00074 * @return None
00075 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00076 typedef void(*cbBTPAN_DataCnf)             (cbBCM_Handle connHandle, cb_int32 result);
00077 
00078 typedef struct
00079 {
00080     cbBTPAN_ConnectEvt     pfConnectEvt;
00081     cbBTPAN_DisconnectEvt  pfDisconnectEvt;
00082     cbBTPAN_DataEvt        pfDataEvt;
00083     cbBTPAN_DataCnf        pfWriteCnf;
00084 }cbBTPAN_Callback;

00104 extern cb_uint32 cbBTPAN_registerDataCallback(cbBTPAN_Callback* pDataCallback);
00105 
00106 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00107 * Sends data to the remote device. Note that you have to wait for the
00108 * confirmation callback (cbBTPAN_DataCnf) before calling another cbBTPAN_reqData.
00109 *
00110 * @param connHandle: Connection handle
00111 * @param pBuf: Pointer to the data
00112 * @param bufSize: Length of the data
00113 *
00114 * @return cbBTPAN_RESULT_OK if successful
00115 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00116 extern cb_int32 cbBTPAN_reqData(cbBCM_Handle connHandle, cb_uint8* pBuf, cb_uint16 bufSize);
00117 
00118 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00119 * Gets the max frame size that can be sent/received with
00120 * cbBTPAN_reqData/pfDataEvt
00121 *
00122 * @return max frame size
00123 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00124 extern cb_int32 cbBTPAN_getMaxFrameSize(void);
